bibl.title: Letter from Rupert Blue to Henry Rose Carter, October 7, 1915

div1.p: Blue orders Carter to Virginia to advise local authorities on anti-malaria measures.

div1.head: Letter from Rupert Blue to Henry Rose Carter, October 7, 1915
div1.opener:
JKb
OFFICE OF THE SURGEON GENERAL
IN REPLYING
ADDRESS THE SURGEON GENERAL
U. S. PUBLIC HEALTH SERVICE
CD
TREASURY DEPARTMENT
BUREAU OF
THE PUBLIC HEALTH SERVICE
WASHINGTON
October 7, 1915.
Assistant Surgeon General H. R. Carter,
U. S. Marine Hospital,
Baltimore, Md.
Sir:
div1.p:
On request of the State Commissioner of Health, you
are hereby directed to proceed via Richmond, Va., to Wil-
sons, Va., and such other points as may be necessary, for
the purpose of advising the authorities in regard to anti-
malaria measures. While at Richmond you will confer with
the State Commissioner of Health in regard to this work.

On completion of this duty, a report in duplicate should
be prepared by you for transmission to the State and local
health authorities.

While on this detail your status will be that of special
temporary duty, and upon completion of the duty enjoined, you
will rejoin your station at Baltimore, Md.
div1.closer:
Respectfully, Rupert Blue
Surgeon General. AnS
The expenses incurred in carrying out the foregoing in-
structions are hereby authorized.
B R Newton
Assistant Secretary.
RB B
